column1: The Cisneros family out in full force for the #WomensMarch2020! https://t.co/uqHu3gCJDC

I’m proud and inspired to march alongside women families activists and allies for the #WomensMarch2020. We won’t stop fighting for women’s rights and equality in #CA39 and across the country. https://t.co/ezhaVoBeaf

This is what’s wrong with Big Pharma. They say they want to lower prices but they’re not even doing it for their own drugs.  I’m fighting to rein in Big Pharma’s price-gouging tactics & make sure that #CA39 families can afford their life-saving medication https://t.co/gBMe3W32DQ
An important step in ensuring every person has access to mental health treatment. We need more of these types of partnerships. https://t.co/UNsykBAnev

#CA39 has one of the largest Korean American communities in the United States. I'm proud to join everyone in our district & across the country in celebrating #KoreanAmericanDay and honor the invaluable contributions Korean Americans have made to our culture economy & society.

This is why we fight for the #ACA:  🔘20 million+ Americans have health insurance 🔘37 states have expanded Medicaid. As a result 19000+ lives have been saved 🔘Pre-exsiting condition protections. 1 in 4 Americans have a pre-existing condition https://t.co/UCKRNWMfyX

Shameful that the Administration continues to undermine the ACA jeopardizing healthcare for countless Americans—in #CA39 & across the US—with pre-existing conditions. Make no mistake: I will not stop fighting to ensure every American has access to quality affordable healthcare.

.@GabbyGiffords serves as an inspiration to us all—turning a tragedy into action and change. While we remember the lives lost and those who survived at Tucson we recommit ourselves to ending gun violence and calling for common-sense gun safety laws. It’s time to #DoSomething. https://t.co/p2V8YjepXa
Sending my prayers to our servicemembers and US civilians in harm’s way in Iraq. https://t.co/SBk66TvBIw

This our future if we don't act on #climatechange now: "the demise of the world’s coral reefs the inundation of most low-lying island nations incessant heat waves and fires and misery for millions—perhaps billions—of people."  We can't let that happen. https://t.co/CvuJz3GrcE

#CA39 sent me to Washington to get work done. That's what I did in 2019 and will continue to do in 2020.  The House passed nearly 400 bills last year 275 of which are bipartisan. It's time for the Senate to get to work and vote on these bills. https://t.co/wTfhajTdFt

American families shouldn’t have to decide whether to put food on the table or pay for their life-saving medication. We need to rein in Big Pharma’s price gouging tactics and put patients and families first. https://t.co/roiF1XYaBT

This is disgraceful. Overturning Roe v. Wade would be dangerous for women in California and across the country. This continued assault on reproductive healthcare needs to stop. https://t.co/V4T7ZJrQ21

As a Navy Veteran it’s outrageous that predatory for-profit colleges cheated our veterans.   It’s why fighting for those who have served our country servicemembers and their families remains my top priority. They deserve better. https://t.co/Q2Nw0HQ6QH
Happy New Year! Wishing you and your loved ones a happy healthy and prosperous 2020. https://t.co/ql2oSWMhtZ

Our fundraising deadline is tonight at midnight! I refuse to accept a dime of corporate PAC money—this campaign is powered by thousands of grassroots donors pitching in to keep #CA39 blue.  It’s all hands on deck! Chip in before midnight. https://t.co/z1VfUJFAEe
From our family to yours wishing everyone a #HappyChristmas and #HappyHolidays! https://t.co/Lgenmat9Vo
Wishing all those who are celebrating a #HappyHanukkah!
Disappointed but not surprised the President would attack me like this in #CA39 - but I won’t back down. https://t.co/vVzkvJdoF9

Happy Thanksgiving to everyone in #CA39! I'm thankful for the opportunity to be your voice in Congress and give you all the representation you deserve. Hoping you all enjoy this time with your family and friends.

Abandoning our allies who have joined us in the fight against ISIS is not the way to promote stability in the Middle East. Because of the President's actions hundreds of thousands have been displaced and are still in search of shelter and water. https://t.co/uEyO8RcZpK

It's not just those we lose. More than 26000 people have been wounded or injured in acts of gun violence this year about 95 people a day. It's time @senatemajldr stops being afraid of the gun lobby and acts on our House-passed gun safety legislation. https://t.co/oXLBATX9YY

Everyone deserves to be counted. The #2020Census is about ensuring our communities receive the federal funding and services they deserve. Spread the word and make sure everyone you know participates. https://t.co/X7X8yrMCyr

Our country has always been a beacon of hope for those fleeing violence and persecution. It's simply unAmerican that the Trump Admin is turning its back on women and children seeking refuge from abuse. https://t.co/0Mrtr7MeyP

We need to take a holistic approach to combat homelessness in SoCal. It's why I've intro'd legislation to fund supportive services for our homeless vets and programs like transitional housing & employment assistance. Together we must end this epidemic. #HHweek #EndHomelessnessOC

I was elected to be a voice for #CA39 & it’s why this week I was focused on pushing VA Secretary Wilkie to step up efforts to combat the veteran suicide crisis. We need to make sure all our veterans receive the mental healthcare benefits they need. https://t.co/xCHfhR9JYG
I had a great time at the Buckboard Days Parade this morning! It was good to see so many students and families from @RowlandSchools! https://t.co/BPP07bxF30
Jacki the boys & I had a great time this morning at @PlacentiaCA's 55th Annual Heritage Festival and Parade! Also great to see Supervisor Doug Chaffee & Mayor Rhonda Shader! https://t.co/QsLmxYD40G

When asked about the Ukraine call Mike Pompeo said he knew nothing about it. Now we know that he was on the call.   The Secretary of State should not be lying to the American people and I am confident that the Congress will get to the bottom of this.  https://t.co/mLYSkDoD2z
Wishing my fellow veteran Dan Feehan good luck. We need more Veterans like Dan in Congress. https://t.co/87xrXXQV1t

ICYMI: I was on MSNBC yesterday standing up to Trump and defending our constitution. You can check the clip out here and I hope that you will stand with me and make a contribution before our next fundraising deadline this evening at midnight! https://t.co/JvQqGf5nV8
Shana Tova! I want to wish a very happy new year to all those in #CA39 who are celebrating Rosh Hashanah!

I was just on MSNBC responding to Rudy Giuliani’s claim that his only job is to protect the President.   His job maybe to protect the President but my job is to protect the Constitution and that’s exactly what our impeachment investigation will do.

“These new allegations are a threat to all we have sworn to protect. We must preserve the checks and balances envisioned by the Founders and restore the trust of the American people in our government. And that is what we intend to do.”  https://t.co/iE0C9lZhhi

Not only did Kevin McCarthy endorse my opponent before she even announced he is now parroting her dangerous rhetoric about election tampering. This hurts trust in our democracy and it is an insult to all the voters who cast valid ballots last years. https://t.co/H5axD4xCK4
Please take a look at the Op-Ed in USA Today that I wrote alongside @RepAnthonyBrown on the president's dangerous manipulation of the defense budget. https://t.co/Lan1PM1WxC

I was thrilled to introduce the Teacher Diversity and Retention Act in the House last week and am glad to see so many of my colleagues join with me to ensure that we have a large representative pool of educators. https://t.co/HO39eaIY2t

However in the days and weeks afterwards the world saw the greatness of America as people from across the country came together to help to heal and sometimes simply just to hold those who had felt the pain of that terrible day directly.

We must always honor the first responders from across the country who ran towards danger and not away from it the passengers of Flight 93 who made the ultimate sacrifice to prevent even more loss of life and our service members at the pentagon and around the world.
18 years ago today America was attacked. We can never forget all those who were so arbitrarily and cruelly taken from their loved ones from their friends and the lives that they had built.

However in the days and weeks afterwards the world saw the greatness of America people from across the country came together to help to heal and sometimes simply just to hold those who had felt the pain of that terrible day directly.

We must always honor the first responders from across the country who ran towards danger and not away from it the passengers of Flight 93 who made the ultimate sacrifice to prevent even more loss of life and our brave service members at the Pentagon and around the world.

When @senatemjldr called himself the grim reaper I am sure that he didn't mean it literally.   However everyday that we fail to act on common sense widely-supported gun safety measures we leave American students teachers and families at risk.  https://t.co/hHR2mvVCxL

That's why I am so proud to have cosponsored bipartisan legislation aimed at improving veterans' transition out of the services and ensuring that any veterans suicides that occur at VA Facilities are promptly disclosed to Congress and the American people.

September is #SuicidePreventionMonth. It's a difficult issue to talk about but on average 20 veterans die per day from suicide. We can and must do more to help ensure that every veteran receives the support they need to transition successfully into civilian life.
On September 9th 1850 a great state formally joined the union. Happy 169th birthday California! https://t.co/te5LJa5sL6

The president's tariffs have wide-ranging consequences. They have increased prices for American consumers slowed down economic growth and now are worsening California's housing crisis.  The trade war has made an average home $20000 - $30000 pricier. https://t.co/0CNUFQg8NX

I was incredibly happy to host our third town hall last week this time at Fullerton College!   We had a wide-ranging discussion and I updated constituents in #CA39 about some of the bipartisan work that I have championed on behalf of our Veterans. https://t.co/JsCCT0lyuO

This month the American manufacturing sector declined for the first time in three years driven by Trump's trade war and the recession it may cause.  This will hurt working families across #CA39 and the country. Enough drama let's get back to business. https://t.co/VMkL9VqrAX

It is unconscionable that President Trump has decided to steal money from our military to build his wall. It is an end run around Congress to fund a vanity project that the American people clearly do not support. https://t.co/XGrEjBuv8O

Jacki and I are proud to support free and independent journalism because the freedom of the press to investigate is not only protected by the First Amendment from government interference it is absolutely essential to hold policy makers accountable. https://t.co/NMbGQ7K1TQ
I’m proud to stand with our brothers and sisters in the Labor movement in their fight for the American worker this Labor Day — and every day. https://t.co/rmj2JwiS9I

99 years ago this week the 19th amendment — a women’s right to vote — was ratified in Congress. Today we honor the labor of all working to expand women’s suffrage by celebrating #WomensEqualityDay. Thank you for helping build a country that represents all of us.

Access to affordable and quality healthcare is a huge issue: for many Americans it can very literally be the difference between life and death. When Trump and his Republican cronies attack your healthcare it isn't just politics: it's personal too. https://t.co/PiNOJ7stde

Our world's largest rainforest has never seen a fire of this scale before. Neither have we. The Amazon produces nearly 20% of the world's oxygen: we must stop these fires and the environmental deregulation that allowed them before it is too late. https://t.co/p0KziOYH05

Without Planned Parenthood millions of American women would be unable to access birth control cancer screenings and crucial vaccines. The Trump Administration's crackdown on services is punitive and unnecessary and puts many vulnerable women at risk. https://t.co/bKVgD8E9TT

As we honor the 99th anniversary of the #19thAmendment and American women winning the right to vote we must remember the importance of protecting that vote. We must ensure our voting systems are safe from interference and that the voices of all those with a vote are heard.

I couldn’t be prouder of the Fullerton Little League team for winning the Junior World Series this weekend. Huge congratulations to all the players & coaches who worked so hard to get here! https://t.co/chGV6BSGZQ
A note of thanks for #TeamGil in #CA39 and across Orange County https://t.co/hflfUJfVjx

The President should not be indulging in race-based theatrics for any reason but especially not to get a cheap laugh out of his donors.  House and Senate Republicans need to denounce this but I’m expecting more silence.  https://t.co/oNEsWaP47u

As a parent and as a Congressman it breaks my heart to read about parents taking their kids back-to-school shopping to pick out bulletproof backpacks. We need to keep our kids safer and we need to make our gun reform stronger — we have no time to lose. https://t.co/dJU1vQrGYX

As a former Navy Officer and the son of a Vietnam veteran I am grateful to hear that Colonel Roy A. Knight has finally been able to come home 52 years after he so bravely made the ultimate sacrifice for our country. May he rest in peace. https://t.co/V4HLTdK7c0

Every day I'm proud to be from #CA39 because when we see members in our community struggling we come together and work for solutions. A college degree is increasingly key for young people's future successes but no student should have to starve for one. https://t.co/hqf4LygZtn

For military families frequent moves can make securing quality healthcare even more complicated than usual — but that care is still crucial.  As a member of a military family I know how much healthcare matters. That’s why I’ll never stop fighting for it. https://t.co/WkrxPcF9AQ

In Mississippi yesterday was the first day of school. Hundreds of children set off with backpacks and packed lunches — and came home to empty houses their parents vanished.   Separating families like this is cruel & traumatic. We must reform our system. https://t.co/PTjKdXUPMG

I was proud to give my testimony to the House Energy & Commerce’s Subcommittee on Health detailing the needs & priorities of #CA39 and reiterating my support for bills like HR 987 HR 1346 and HR 1046 — all of which work to lower our healthcare costs. https://t.co/uXPE98qiQb

In 2016 OC saw the start of the #BlueWave.   In 2018 we flipped #CA39 for the first time since the 1930s.   In 2019 Democratic voter registration surpassed Republicans.  The #BlueWave wasn’t a moment. It’s a movement. We’re just getting started.  https://t.co/AEHR13RoF2

Affordable healthcare is a human right and being unable to access it has a real human cost: American families lose loved ones every day because they just can't afford their care. Pharmaceutical price-gouging isn't just unethical — it's deadly too. https://t.co/dDn0xBFe7s

We passed 2 gun control bills in February. But @senatemajldr has blocked them in the Senate — and now he's gone on vacation instead. Come back and do the job you've been avoiding all year Mitch. Enough is enough.

Today on #NationalPurpleHeartDay we recognize our nation's oldest military honor and all those who have sacrificed their health or their lives protecting our rights and liberty. Each and every day we thank you for your service. Grateful doesn't even begin to come close.

Last week my colleagues in the House and I visited ICE/CBP facilities at the border.   Being there it’s even clearer to me how deeply our system is broken — not just for immigrants but for border patrol too. We need comprehensive reform. Now.

54 years ago today the Voting Rights Act was signed into law. Its intention was to protect democracy for all of us no matter which district we lived in or the color of our skin. But in 2013 it was gutted – now it's even more at risk. A brief history: https://t.co/uS1bwQxFdK

For them we must fight even harder every day. Not one more mother should ever have to explain to their child that their father isn't coming home like my grandmother had to tell my Mom. Not one more dad; not one more mom; not one more sibling friend or child.  Not one more.

With Republicans like @senatemajldr blocking every bill we in the House send through to the Senate — and a President whose comments constantly fuel racist fire — our fight is hard. But in just 24 hours we have lost 30 fathers mothers siblings and babies in 2 cities.

Every day in DC & in #CA39 I work to honor my grandfather's memory & the memories of all lost to gun violence. I refuse to let those lost – in my family and so many around the country – be in vain. And so every day I fight as hard as I can to pass common-sense gun reform.

We must unite too against the senseless cruelty of gun violence. My colleagues & I know personally how gun violence can hurt families & individuals for generations. It was gun violence that took my grandfather from my Mom when she was just a six-year-old girl.

This weekend we saw again the horrific destruction that racist xenophobic rhetoric & decades of resistance to common-sense gun reform can unleash. White supremacy is deep-rooted but we can unite against it. We must. We cannot lose any more families or lives to its hatred.

So glad to see that the Legion Act is officially law and all our service members who put their lines on the line will now be eligible to participate in this wonderful patriotic organization. https://t.co/I7IjO1TcDw

I am proud to have cosponsored the inclusion of the World Language Advancement and Readiness Act (WLARA) in the NDAA for 2020. Fluency in languages other than English is critical for the strengthening both national security & our relationships with allies. https://t.co/z0JpefmjdI

I was glad to see that healthcare was a central issue of the #DemDebate last night — it's a central issue in the lives of all Americans in 2019. As your Congressman I will always fight to #ProtectOurCare and keep healthcare reform a central issue in Congress in 2020 and beyond. https://t.co/YImK2vgm0Q

Protecting our healthcare & tackling Big Pharma are that much harder without campaign and government finance reforms to @StopBigMoney. In Jan. the House passed the #ForThePeopleAct keeping special interests out of politics. Now we must put #ReformFirst & fight to make it law.

Robocalls are more than a nuisance: they're often scams tricking us into financial traps. In the House we've been working to protect our constituents against their predatory practices — and just this last week we passed the Stopping Bad Robocalls Act https://t.co/7STIwLakwZ

If someone is willing to risk everything to protect our country the least we can offer them in return is membership in the American Legion and the post-service benefits they deserve. I'm proud that the House-passed #LEGION Act finally makes this possible. https://t.co/6Rc8UwBvMA

My heart goes out to those killed and injured in Gilroy by yet another senseless act of gun violence. I know personally how gun violence can rip apart families for generations.  We need common sense gun safety legislation passed NOW and we need politicians who will act.

I told them we had rights and asked to make a phone call. But they told us 'You don't have rights to anything' Galicia told the paper.  Francisco Galicia 18 yrs old & a US-born citizen was detained for 23 days. It's appalling. It's unconstitutional.  https://t.co/vQthHfFleV

Deeply frustrated that 2 bills we passed in the House to ensure our nation's elections are safe & secure were blocked by the Senate today. Fair & free elections are the backbone of this country. All of us in Congress have a responsibility to protect them. https://t.co/LixOhYgl4x

Trump's plan to cut food stamps for millions of Americans is an absolute disgrace to our nation's values and I will do everything in my power to fight it. No child should have to go to bed on an empty stomach. No American deserves to go hungry. https://t.co/b6xoCKv8b8

Families in America shouldn't be just one unexpected ER visit away from bankruptcy. And yet without the #ACA many of them would be. As your Congressman I'll keep fighting to defend the #ACA and all the millions of Americans who rely on it every single day.
@NixonLibrary Only one or two parsecs!

The Trump Administration's expedited removal announcement will put many Americans at the risk of wrongful deportation and only further increase fear in the homes of millions more. As a House united we must fight back against this extreme new policy. https://t.co/zLipzQthEo
It was great to honor all who worked on Apollo 11's mission 50 years ago with a tour of @NixonLibrary and a 5k run/walk this weekend. Always happy to be home in #CA39! https://t.co/pY8zw8lWEn

The tax bill pushed by Congressional Republicans benefited big corporations at the expense of California homeowners.  That’s why I intro’d a bill to restore the #SALT tax breaks and invest in Orange County families.   https://t.co/LQD52Eahxz

.@PPFA has long provided vital services—mammograms birth control & vaccines—to women across the country regardless of their ability to pay. This Administration's newest #TitleX #GagRule is a shameful attack on women's health. I will continue to stand up to it everywhere I can.

Children & families at the border are held in overcrowded cells in horrific conditions. No drinking water. No showers. No diapers. In Congress I'm working to fix it and my consponsorship of the Humanitarian Standards for Individuals in CBP Custody Act is part of that work.

Scientists must be free from retaliation & suppression but Trump continues to block & suppress research on climate change. To fight it I'm proud to cosponsor the #ScientificIntegrityAct. We must do our jobs in Congress so scientists can do theirs in the labs. #ScienceNotSilence

It is plain wrong that drug companies are artificially rasing prices to increase their profits while everyday Americans suffer. As your Congressman I'll keep fighting to ensure prescription drugs are affordable for all of us and I'll always put people over Big Pharma's profits.

Reflecting on my first 6 mo. in Congress I'm most proud of supporting our veterans & service members across the US. Working with colleagues across the aisle I've passed bills like the Blue Water Navy Bill & introduced five others. Many more are to come. https://t.co/P2y7seo0u0

Health conditions & medical emergencies don't discriminate based on the size of someone's bank account. Accidents and illnesses can — and do — happen to everyone. It is vital that we protect the #ACA and make sure access to healthcare isn't just reserved for the wealthy.

These men put everything on the line to defend our freedom in WWII. It was a great privilege to spend some time in Hacienda Heights honoring them with my colleagues @RepJudyChu and @RepMarkTakano. I look forward to seeing the Gold Medal's final design. https://t.co/UgDdv0QOAJ
The tweets the president sent this morning are factually wrong and racist. I'm incredibly proud to serve as part of such a diverse caucus and work alongside so many strong women.

Millions of Americans are at risk of losing their healthcare if the Trump administration wins in court. Now more than ever we must continue the fight to #ProtectOurCare and ensure we keep the #ACA and those with pre-existing conditions safe. https://t.co/H959tJrtY6

@angeil @Dodgers Thanks Angela! Hope you are well. #goblue

Happy Fourth of July from our whole family to you and yours! https://t.co/oJWdJoQSeF
